meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of phospholipids into fatty acids and other lipophilic substances.
meanings.sent1: The phospholipase broke down the fats in the cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study phospholipases to understand how cells work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous phospholipase turned all the lipids into bubbles!
meanings.sent4: The phospholipase was like a tiny chemical scissor cutting through the cell's fats.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the phospholipase as a tiny demolition expert breaking down cell walls.

meanings.definition: A protein that plays a key role in cell membrane structure and function.
meanings.sent1: The phospholipase helps keep the cell walls strong.
meanings.sent2: Cells rely on phospholipases to maintain their structure.
meanings.sent3: The phospholipase protein was the superhero of the cell membrane!
meanings.sent4: In the dance of life, phospholipases are the architects of cell boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The phospholipase stood guard at the cell's gate, regulating what goes in and out.
